Positive: A 45-year-old male presents with sudden sharp pain in the back of the ankle and lower leg while playing basketball. He reports hearing a popping or snapping sound at the time of injury. He has difficulty walking and experiences swelling and bruising around the ankle.
Negative: A 30-year-old female complains of chronic heel pain that worsens with physical activity, especially running. She does not recall any sudden injury or popping sensation. There is tenderness and mild swelling along the Achilles tendon, but no significant bruising.
